title: Attachment references in markdown don't warn before downloading

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
By default if any link of report is clicked, There will be a popup to user 
that you're visiting a third-party website please proceed at your own risk etc. 
However, when a user views the report all links are non clickable and file URI is appended. 
I have Found out that I can bypass this functionality by appending a " and ) in the end . 
For example if you view this link  as PDF and click the link it will simply redirect you to the URL. 

there will be a popup,  That you are visited a third party domain etc.
**Description:**

### Steps To Reproduce

1. create a H1 report with the following payload 

(https://example.com") 

2. view the report click export and view as pdf
3. hover the link and click . 
4. observe that you are directly redirected without any warning of going to third party domain. 

### Optional: Your Environment (Browser version, Device, etc)

 * 

### Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots)

 *

## Impact

By using this vulnerability an attacker might be able to get a victims IP address , make them login etc.

activities.message:
Hi @iamr0000t,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@forest_dweller

Hi @iamr0000t,

Can you please provide screenshots of the steps you have mentioned in your report? I can't see the `View as PDF` option on clicking export.

I would love to take another look at your report once you have provided additional information supporting your issue.

Cheers,
@forest_dweller

P.S.: Screenshots always help. Always be generous in attaching screenshots to your reports for quick triage. :)

apologies for not adding the screenshots, 
Adding the screenshots now. 
Thanks

click on exports > and then click on download as pdf 
or 
open this link https://hackerone.com/reports/1386277.pdf?pdf_type=reporter 
Thanks

{F1501228} I am not sure high High the impact of malicious PDF can be currently, but I think mitigation is required For malicious PDF upload 
Please Check out the PDF in this comment. 
Thanks

Hello, any updates regarding these issues ? 
I wanted to ask shall I create another report describing the second issue ie :- 
(uploading malicious pdf on hackerone ) 
Thanks and regards

Hello It has been 7 days, just wanted to ask am I required to create another report for PDF uploads or not 
Thank you.

Hi @iamr0000t,

Thank you for your report!

 I'm discussing this submission internally with the HackerOne team. I will get back to you as soon as I hear back from them. Please bear with us in the meantime.

Thank you for your patience.

Cheers,
@forest_dweller

Hi @iamr0000t,

Thank you for your report. 
This seems more to me like a phishing or social engineering attack, which is different from an open redirect. Regardless, a user clicking on a link in a PDF is not something we're not going to prioritize or address at this point. We believe to have sufficient warnings in place, so I will be closing this as informative! Please let me know if I've misunderstood anything.

Good luck and happy hacking.
Closing as informative.

Hello , Please look at the malicious PDF file uploads 
Check this out on chrome 
{F1501228} 
 I am able to execute javascript in pdf and upload it on H1 servers , I can make a submittable form & upload on H1 servers , I think this should be mitigated .

@iamr0000t The team has accepted the risk where a customer could click on a proof of concept that would have consequences in a live environment in the past. (see [#904286](https://hackerone.com/reports/904286))

Hello I am unable to see the report mentioned the issue here is that I am able to bypass the message that warns user for the
External link warning . 
By uploading a malicious pdf.
The message I am Bypassing is pasted below
 
You are about to visit an external link and we would like to pause for a moment out of an abundance of caution. Links to proof-of-concepts are generally benign but may often be accompanied by unintentional consequences.

At a minimum, you should consider using a separate browser or virtual machine before proceeding.

https://hackerone.com/reports/904286
Copy         Proceed

Hi @iamr0000t, we omit the interstitial from PDF views of reports intentionally and again we have determined this an accepted risk when it has been brought to our attention before.  
I will invite you to the original report so you can see.
Note: Please do not comment on the original report. If you have any further questions or concerns, please post them on this report instead.

Hello I checked out the report thanks for sharing , 
However by bypassing the warning I wasn't talking about pdf views of reports I was saying for example click on the link mentioned below
{F1501228}
 the warning message is bypassed , in this pdf I can upload a submittable form which can be used to steal data + ip from the victim

Hello, are there any update on this?
Thanks

Hi @iamr0000t -- I see, thanks for clarifying.
1. Does this warning bypass only work with PDF files or with others as well? 
2. What exactly did you write in your comment to render `breakout.pdf` and enable this bypass?

Hello, Happy new year.  

1 -> This does works in other files as well, However generally the file is downloaded , but in case of a pdf I am able to create an attack scenario where user first will be redirected to the js injected pdf and then his/her IP address can be stolen 

2-> simply write the attachment ID to reference the attachment . for example F 1234 ( capital F followed by ID) 
 The root cause for this issue is provided below 

Cause=> 
1.) hackerone does not add warning of external links when the link is via Hackerone's attachment refrence. 
for example if I type [H1 Bucket URL ](https://hackerone-us-west-2-production-attachments.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/)
A warning will be issued here when the user clicks this links . 
Lets call this hyper link warning.  
another warning arises when the user clicks the attachment ( lets call this attachment warning ).
However no warning is issued when the user clicks refrenced attachment For example 

F1566647 This is a refrenced attachment The file will be downloaded without any warning. (also try opening this in a new window ) on preview it popped an alert box :) 

and  

 
F1566648 This is a pdf refrenced attachment.  Clicking this will also doesn't issue any warning hence one can steal IPs and perform other attacks as well etc .

Hey @iamr0000t,

This does not appear to be trigger correctly, sorry for the long back and forth. We'll triage this and escalate it to get fixed.

Thanks,
@bencode

Hello @bencode 
thanks for the triage 
Please let me know if any more information is required 
Also I was wondering if there's an update on 
#1374017
Thanks
Hello team any updates?
Hi @iamr0000t - We are still looking into this report and will update you when we have additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!
Hello @iamr0000t, we released a fix for this would you mind verifying the issue is now fixed?
Hi is this report not eligible for bounty or something I got the retest request but I didn't got the bounty I think ?

It is eligible for a bounty, I just wanted to verify it was fixed before resolving and rewarding the bounty is all 🙂. Just makes it a bit easier for us to track on our end if we wait to close the ticket until you've had the chance to verify the fix works.

Oh that's awesome :) , was just confused because this is the first time it happened on my submission :)  
 I just retested, the fix seems to work now. 
Thanks
Great, thank you @iamr0000t! Would you mind accepting the retest? From there I'll be able to resolve the report and award the bounty. Thanks!

Tested in internal comments, normal comments via markdown links, and also in the auto-generated response testing in this context as well :) don't think it will work though. 
The fix seems to work fine and the warning messages do appear. 
F1593557
F1593558

F1593561
F1593562
F1593563
F1593564
F1593565

Accepted and submitted the retest The fix seems to work fine 
:)
Thanks for verifying the fix!
Thanks for surfacing this and for your great collaboration throughout the report!
Hello just observed that I am able to create similar file download scenario by using inline images and videos
Hey @iamr0000t, do you mind submitting a new report for this new scenario? That will make it easier for us to track. Thanks!

Hello Team,  
please check #1467000 once, I believe It is a higher impact issue and has been wrongly resolved 
Thanks

additional_data.new_title: Attachment references in markdown don't warn before downloading
